meanings.definition: A person who hocks or pawns items for money.
meanings.sent1: The hockers at the shop were always busy helping customers.
meanings.sent2: I saw a hockers at the pawn shop selling old jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The hockers joked about finding hidden treasures in the items people pawned.
meanings.sent4: She was a skilled hockers, turning unwanted items into cash like magic.
meanings.sent5: The hockers' job is to assess the value of items and offer fair prices.

meanings.definition: To pawn or sell items for money.
meanings.sent1: He decided to hockers his guitar to pay for the repairs.
meanings.sent2: People often hockers valuable items when they need quick cash.
meanings.sent3: She hockers her old books to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent4: In tough times, many families have to hockers their belongings to make ends meet.
meanings.sent5: The man had to hockers his watch to afford the train ticket.

meanings.definition: A place where items are pawned or sold.
meanings.sent1: The hockers was filled with all sorts of items waiting to be sold.
meanings.sent2: I visited the hockers to see if I could find any good deals.
meanings.sent3: The hockers had a unique smell that reminded me of my childhood.
meanings.sent4: She found a rare painting at the hockers that turned out to be worth a fortune.
meanings.sent5: The hockers was bustling with activity as people came in to pawn their items.
